intro: Pasania confragosa, commonly known as the fragrant pasania, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Pasania confragosa is typically found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
